caption.p: Chest radiograph of viral bronchiolitis in infancy. Chest x-rays in neonates and infants with respiratory viral illness are characterized by peribronchial thickening. This example caused by parainfluenza virus and adenovirus infection also shows nonspecific streaky atelectasis in the right lung (Contributed by Dr. Jason Weinman, Department of Radiology, Childrenâ€™s Hospital Colorado and University of Colorado School of Medicine, Aurora, Colorado, with permission)
